bug.author: EliaCereda
bug.summary: ModelCheckpoint filenames and metric names containing / (slash)
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
The current behaviour of ModelCheckpoint is problematic when the checkpoint's name includes a metric whose name contains a slash character. Since the implementation always includes the name of the metric along with its value, a format specifier like {some/name} results in the checkpoint being stored in a subdirectory. Everything appears to work correctly apart from the inconvenience of having a subdirectory which is not deleted when deleting old checkpoints. <denchmark-h:h2>Reproducer</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1E4EKc2Ndt4XluRjpGC83hyohyF0BQESU?usp=sharing>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1E4EKc2Ndt4XluRjpGC83hyohyF0BQESU?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
The two lines marked as # STEP 1: ... and # STEP 2: ... are sufficient to reproduce the issue, the checkpoints are stored in lightning_logs/version_0/checkpoints. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I haven't found a way to avoid this problem, because the substitution from {metric} to metric=value is hardcoded in PyTorch Lightning code. I don't particularly care about the specific name of my checkpoints, so I'd propose for PL to automatically escape the slashes to some other character. Alternatively, PL should provide a way to manually specify a different name for the metric in the filename or a way to suppress the name altoghether. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
